titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. G. W. Stivers, Indictment
CWG5139

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Clay Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment
G W Stivers
The Grand Jury of Clay County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse George W Stivers of the crime of Murder committed as follows viz

The said George W Stivers did on the 19th day of Nov 1863, in the county aforesaid with malice aforethought kill and murder Jerry Griffin by shooting him with a pistol against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

Witnesses
J H Pierce
John Lankesly
Isaac Holland
William Carroll
Mrs Cid Williams
Lieut Smith

(Endorsements)
A True bill AT White foreman
filed Nov Term 1863, Bail $200
a copy attest
S W Price Clerk Clay Circuit Court
